titles.ar: باب التَّمَنْدُلِ وَ مَسْحِ الْوَجْهِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The towel and wiping of the face after the ablution

titles.ar: باب التَّسْمِيَةِ وَ التَّحْمِيدِ وَ الدُّعَاءِ عَلَى الطَّعَامِ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The Naming (Bismillah), and the Praising (Al-Hamdulillah), and the supplication upon the meal
Chapter 45 – Description of the ablution before the meal

titles.ar: باب التَّمَنْدُلِ وَ مَسْحِ الْوَجْهِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The towel and wiping of the face after the ablution

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/105)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِي مَحْمُودٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا غَسَلْتَ يَدَكَ لِلطَّعَامِ فَلَا تَمْسَحْ يَدَكَ بِالْمِنْدِيلِ فَإِنَّهُ لَا تَزَالُ الْبَرَكَةُ فِي الطَّعَامِ مَا دَامَتِ النَّدَاوَةُ فِي الْيَدِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Abu Mahmoud, from his father, from a man who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When you have washed your hands for the meal, so do not wipe your hand with the towel, for the Blessings do not cease in the meal for as long as the moisture is in the hand’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from abu Mahmud from his father from a man who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ’When you wash your hand for food do not wipe it with a towel because blessings continue in the food as long as hands have moisture in them/”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/105)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُرَازِمٍ قَالَ

text: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا تَوَضَّأَ قَبْلَ الطَّعَامِ لَمْ يَمَسَّ الْمِنْدِيلَ وَ إِذَا تَوَضَّأَ بَعْدَ الطَّعَامِ مَسَّ الْمِنْدِيلَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Marazam who said,

‘I saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> when he<sup>asws</sup> performed ablution before the meal, he<sup>asws</sup> did not wipe the towel, and when he<sup>asws</sup> perform ablution after the meal, he<sup>asws</sup> wiped the towel’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Um ay r from Murazim who has said the following: “I saw abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, when making wudu (washing his hands) before food did not wipe his hands with a towel, but he wiped them when he (the Imam) made wudu after food.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/105)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ زَيْدٍ الشَّحَّامِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ

text: هُ كَرِهَ أَنْ يَمْسَحَ الرَّجُلُ يَدَهُ بِالْمِنْدِيلِ وَ فِيهَا شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنَ الطَّعَامِ تَعْظِيماً لِلطَّعَامِ حَتَّى يَمُصَّهَا أَوْ يَكُونَ عَلَى جَنْبِهِ صَبِيٌّ يَمُصُّهَا .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Al Magra, from Zayd Al Shahaam,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having disliked that the man wipes his hand with the towel and in it is something from the food, as a reverence for the meal, until he licks it, or that happens to be a child upon his side who licks it’.
en.sarwar: 3. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from abu al-Mighra’ from Zayd al-Shahham who has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, disliked wiping his hands with a towel because of food stains due to sanctity of food, until he (the Imam) absorbed them or a child next to him (the Imam) did so.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/105)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ يَرْفَعُهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَسْحُ الْوَجْهِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْكَلَفِ وَ يَزِيدُ فِي الرِّزْقِ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from one of his men, from Ibrahim Bin Uqba,
(It has been narrated) raising it to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Wipe the face after the ablution does away with the troubles and increases in the livelihood’.
en.sarwar: 4. Al-Husayn from Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla’ ibn Muhammad from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from certain persons of his people from Ibrahim ibn ‘Uqbah in a marfu 1 manner has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ’Wiping one’s hands with a towel after wudu (washing) removes troubles and increases sustenance.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مختلف فيه - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/105)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ رَفَعَهُ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ قَالَ

text: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَشَكَوْتُ إِلَيْهِ الرَّمَدَ فَقَالَ لِي أَ وَ تُرِيدُ الطَّرِيفَ ثُمَّ قَالَ لِي إِذَا غَسَلْتَ يَدَكَ بَعْدَ الطَّعَامِ فَامْسَحْ حَاجِبَيْكَ وَ قُلْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الْمُحْسِنِ الْمُجْمِلِ الْمُنْعِمِ الْمُفْضِلِ قَالَ فَفَعَلْتُ ذَلِكَ فَمَا رَمِدَتْ عَيْنِي بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, raising it from Al Mufazzal who said,

‘I went over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so I complained to him<sup>asws</sup> of the conjunctivitis. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Or would you like something odd?’ Then he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Whenever you wash your hands after the meal, so wipe your eyelids, and say three times, ‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the Bestower, the Aggregate, the Benefactor, the Gracious’. He (the narrator) said, ‘So I did that, so I did not have conjunctivitis in my eye after that, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the Worlds’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Muhammad in a marfu‘ manner has narrated from al-Mufaddal who has said the following: “I once visited abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and complained before him (the Imam) about eye ache. He (the Imam) said, ‘Do you want something unique?’ He (the Imam) then said to me, ‘When you wash your hands after eating food, wipe your eye brows and say three times, “All praise belongs to Allah, the Benefactor, the Graceful, the Munificent, the Pre-eminent.’” He (the narrator) has said, ‘I followed the instruction and thereafter my eyes did not experience any pain and ache, all praise belongs to Allah, Cherisher of the worlds.’”
